ai.summary: A 6.9 km section of the Cotswold Way via Selsley Common, offering open heathland views and rolling countryside. The route is of moderate difficulty, suitable for walkers with some experience, and rewards with scenic glimpses of the surrounding landscape.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily grassy heathland with well-trodden paths, plus short stretches of lanes. Expect uneven footing in places, occasional gravel or dirt surfaces, and open exposure to wind; sturdy, waterproof footwear is recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather before you go. Wear sturdy boots and dress in layers; the heath can be exposed and windy. Stay on marked paths, watch for uneven ground or mud, and carry a map or GPS. Bring enough water and snacks, sun protection in sunny weather, and a small first-aid kit. If walking with dogs, keep them under control and clean up after them. Inform someone of your plan and expected return time.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly May–September) generally offers the best conditions and views; the route is hikeable year-round with proper gear and daylight considerations.
